A 1-13 spanking on Anubis will do little for Cloud9's confidence overall, particularly considering the fact they were pushed all the way on the other maps, but they got the job done. Sergey "Ax1Le" Rykhtorov's resurgent form is a big plus for Cloud9, the No. 4 player in the world in 2022 was a significant factor in his team managing to clinch the qualification series. Sangal and SAW have joined SINNERS in securing RMR qualification. Sangal, who have been in excellent form in recent months, had to battle through tough maps against BC.Game and BLEED, but ultimately Samet "jottAAA" Köklü's strong showings helped get them over the line. SAW followed up their immense IEM Cologne run with a fairly comfortable stroll through the closed qualifier, the usual suspects of João "story" Vieira, Michel "ewjerkz" Pinto and Rafael "arrozdoce" Wing doing much of the heavy lifting. SINNERS have qualified for the Shanghai Major Europe RMR, and it was in no small part due to the superlative performances of Tomáš "oskar" Šťastný. The AWPer rolled back the years to harken back to his prime form to guide SINNERS through the closed qualifier with minimal fuss. We're really getting to the business end of things now in the Europe RMR qualifiers, with a raft of qualification best-of-threes getting underway. Plenty of the big-name teams are fighting in this round of matches: Both Sashi and Monte are at risk of having their Major dreams ended early. Sashi, the third highest-ranked team in their qualifier, find themselves in the 1-2 pool after a hard-fought loss against Nemiga. The Danes had already dropped a game to Qiang earlier in the qualifier. Monte meanwhile were comfortably bested by ECLOT, a team over 20 places below them in the world ranking, having already lost to KOI yesterday. We're back for more Perfect World Shanghai Major qualification action, and already there are teams who will have their hearts broken and teams who will get to the next step chasing their dreams. Aleksandar "kassad" Trifunović's BLEED are one step from the RMR, alongside the likes of Cloud9 and SAW, whilst surprisingly Lukas "gla1ve" Rossander's ENCE are already fighting for their lives in an elimination match, as are the Danes of TSM. Qualification matches 1-1 matches Elimination matches The first day of the qualifiers for the RMR events has come to an end. Here is all that you need to know: Unlucky Much? join DRILLAS and POGGERZ in securing a spot in the Middle East closed qualifier for the Asian RMR via the Levant and North Africa open qualifiers. The Algerian team beat Lebanon in a close two-map series. With the first two rounds now behind us, here are the match-ups for the third round, which will already include advancement (Bo3) and elimination (Bo3) matches: Group A Group B After being stunned by Passion UA in the first round of the EU RMR Closed Qualifier B, BIG picked up their first win as they brushed aside Insilio on Ancient. The German outfit will now enter the 1-1 pool, which also includes teams like Nemiga, OG and Rebels. SAW, the highest-ranked team in the EU RMR closed qualifiers, are one victory away from the LAN event after thrashing Qiang 13-4  on Nuke. Meanwhile, 9 Pandas made light work of Rebels, beating the Polish team 13-5 on Nuke. The two teams join Cloud9 and Permitta in the 2-0 pool. The qualifying matches will be played tomorrow at 13:00 . 1WIN, who made headlines last month after signing Abay "HObbit" Khassenov from Cloud9, are facing elimination in Closed Qualifier A after losing to Sangal and ECLOT. The PGL Major Krakow champion put in a game-high 1.49 rating but it was not enough as his team lost 13-11 on Mirage. Frederik "acoR" Gyldstrand was helpless to prevent a defeat against his former team as TSM were thrashed 13-3 by GamerLegion in the 0-1 pool of the EU RMR Closed Qualifier A. This means that Valdemar "valde" Bjørn Vangså's troops are now one loss away from elimination. In the first round, TSM lost to BLEED 13-8. DRILLAS, the mix team that is supported by streamer ohnePixel, has secured a spot in the Middle East closed qualifier for the Asian RMR after beating Unlucky Much? 2-0 in the semi-finals of the Levant and North Africa open qualifier. Later today, DRILLAS will play a best-of-one game against the winner of the other semi-final, for seeding purposes. Passion UA were on their way to tallying another upset after beating BIG in the first round. Down 5-7 after their CT side on Mirage, they won five on the trot to make it 10-7, but everything changed when they lost to an eco and the Ukrainians deflated as Cloud9 won it out, 10-13. The second round of the European closed qualifier is underway with four 1-0 matches, two in each group. The second round of matches in the EU RMR Closed Qualifier is set, they are: The Levant and North Africa open qualifier has reached the final round, whose winners will advance to the MIddle East closed qualifier. ohnePixel's DRILLAS team and the former Twisted Minds core now competing as POGGERZ are both in play, and you can follow the action on HLTV: Meanwhile, Richard "shox" Papillon's mix-team was eliminated in the second round by Lebanon. Group A Group B 9 Pandas were embroiled in a dramatic situation with Aurora, as a trade which would see Evgeny "r3salt" Frolov join the side while Timur "clax" Sabirov went the other way was initially called off. Finally, the trade went through moments before 9 Pandas' opening match, and r3salt put in a fine performance (1.40 rating, 17-9, 99.5 ADR) in his debut victory after officially becoming a member of the team against Insilio (he had previously played an ESL Challenger League match with the team before his transfer was made official). Guy "anarkez" Trachtman was joint-best in BC.Game's opener alongside Aleksandar "CacaNito" Kjulukoski in their first victory in Group A of the EU RMR's closed qualifier. The Israeli AWPer handed his former team, ECLOT, their first defeat in the tournament while tallying a 1.22 rating. The match, played on Mirage, was close and decided in extra rounds, 16-19. It didn't take long for SINNERS to dismantle B8 on Nuke. The two teams last played each other only a few days ago, on August 12, in ESL Challenger League, with the Czech squad also clearing their Ukrainian foes, that time by 2-0. Tomáš "oskar" Šťastný was the star of the show as he led the way on the T side with 13 kills and capped a fantastic game after the switch. SINNERS took their 9-3 lead and ran to victory with a clean 4-0 on the defense. The South African open qualifier is the last of the three leading up to the Middle East closed qualifier to kick off, and it most notably features Bravado, who recently made a move to Serbia in the second running of 'Project Destiny'. They are playing among 12 other teams for three closed qualifier spots, and the bracket can be found here on Challenger Mode. The Levant and North Africa open qualifier has just gotten underway with 15 teams in play for three spots in the Middle East closed qualifier. Some well-known names are in play here: - DRILLAS, a mix-team featuring the likes of Volodymyr "Woro2k" Veletniuk and Ali "hAdji" Haïnouss that is supported by German streamer ohnePixel - POGGERZ24 with the former Twisted Minds core including Shuaib "D0cC" Ahmad and Deyvid "h4rn" Benchev - SSS GHOULS featuring Richard "shox" Papillon You can find the bracket on Challenger Mode. It looked like SAW were en route to a 13-0 mauling of OG in Group B after a 12-0 half on Anubis. The Portuguese squad, fresh off their IEM Cologne semi-final finish, couldn't manage the feat after the switch, however, and OG delayed the inevitable for a further eight rounds. BLEED got one over TSM in Group A as Nemanja "nexa" Isaković topped the board with 26-15 KD, 121 ADR, and a 1.69 rating in a 13-8 victory on Ancient. The Arabian open qualifier has just kicked off with nine teams vying for two spots in the Middle East closed qualifier for the Asia RMR. Among them are Issa "ISSAA" Murad's JiJieHao, who have just benched Markus "Kjaerbye" Kjærbye and have submitted Viktor "Duplicate" Mitev for the tournament, and Onyx Ravens as the most notable names. You can follow the bracket here. The deciding semi-finals will be featured on HLTV. The first round of matches has come to an end. BIG fell to Passion UA and Cloud9 got their first win in Group B over Johnny Speeds. KOI sent ENCE down to the 0-1 pool in Group A and Sangal beat 1WIN. Coming up next: BIG 3-13  Passion UA It didn't take long to get our first upset, and in what fashion! Passion UA thrashed BIG on Anubis, 13-3, to go 1-0 in the B qualifier. The Perfect World Shanghai Major qualifiers are officially underway, as the first round of the Swiss groups in the European closed qualifier has started. The first round of matches is: The Europe RMR closed qualifiers are due to start and just an hour ahead of the kick-off of the first rounds of matches, Johnny Speeds announced they will play against Cloud9 with Sebastian "dex" Samuelsson instead of Hugo "chawzyyy" Günther. According to Dust2.se, Johnny Speeds coach Christian "chrille" Lindberg said chawzyyy would miss at least the opening day — so at least two matches — due to a personal reason. You can find the rest of the matches on the event pages for the A group and B group. Welcome. The next 10 days are about to get all kinds of hectic as online qualifiers are taking place all around the world to decide the remaining 29 teams who will participate in the Regional Major Ranking events leading up to the Perfect World Shanghai Major. To help you keep track of all the action from the dozen or so qualifying tournaments in Europe, the Americas, Asia, Oceania and Africa, this will be your one place to come back to find out the latest news. First, to see how it will all play out and what teams will be vying to keep their Major hopes alive from August 21-30, you can check our round-up below:

header: Short news: Week 35
text: Just four teams are left standing in the IEM Rio Europe closed qualifier after the conclusion of the lower bracket semi-finals, which saw 3DMAX and Cloud9 eliminated from contention. Kirill "Boombl4" Mikhailov's men started strong with a comfortable win over HEROIC, but lost in one-sided fashion to Eternal Fire in the upper bracket before dropping two close maps to fnatic to miss out on Rio. HEROIC saw to the elimination of 3DMAX to set up a match against fnatic at 17:30 , which will be played simultaneous to the first Rio qualifying match between Falcons and Eternal Fire. There's a war of words developing between FURIA and 9 Pandas, and Gabriel "FalleN" Toledo will get his wish. shalfey to HLTV: "Beating FURIA was not a big win for us ... I feel that we are a very strong team, and not everyone right now understands that." FalleN, to Esports.gg: "I already won 11 world championships and now have to play against 9 Pandas and lose. It's really sad because they're not that good — I'm looking forward to play them again." Blue Otter, an organization competing in the North American Challengers division in League of Legends, has entered Counter-Strike with the signing of Emmalee "EMUHLEET" Garrido's Karma lineup. The roster, playing as Blue Otter Karma, is competing in ESL Impact League Season 7 and recently swapped Carolyn "artStar" Noquez for Anna "buhnny" Cheung in hopes of qualifying for an Impact League Finals event for the first time. Blue Otter Karma is: Emmalee "EMUHLEET" Garrido Amanda "rain" Smith Olga "olya" Kryvulych Elena "Ellie" Garland Anna "buhnny" Cheung David "Xp3" Garrido (coach) The second round of the IEM Rio European closed qualifier came to an end with OG and B8 getting eliminated after two consecutive losses. Cloud9, fnatic, 3DMAX, and HEROIC all reside in the lower bracket after day one and are set to fight for their tournament lives, while Eternal Fire and Falcons have set up an upper-bracket final qualification clash. The day two schedule is as follows: The IEM Rio Europe closed qualifier is underway with eight teams battling through a best-of-three, double-elimination bracket for two spots at the Brazilian event. The opening round of games has ended with two notable upsets, seeing fnatic and HEROIC sent careening down to the lower bracket following losses to 3DMAX and Cloud9, respectively. Damjan "kyxsan" Stoilkovski's side is in a particularly torrid run of form, getting eliminated early from BLAST Fall Showdown in floundering fashion, and now needs to win four best-of-threes in a row if they want to make it to Rio — starting with a match against B8 at 19:30 . Rhyno have announced that they have brought in Filipe "NOPEEJ" Dias and David "P3R3IIRA" Pereira to replace Diogo "DDias" Dias and Tiago "TMKj" Martins. The Portuguese team, currently ranked 88th in the world, recently finished the EU RMR Closed Qualifier with a 1-3 record after losing to BLEED, UNiTY and B8. Their sole victory came against GamerLegion. With these changes, Rhyno are now: Diogo "snapy" Rodrigues André "Ag1l" Gil Adones "krazy" Nobre Filipe "NOPEEJ" Dias David "P3R3IIRA" Pereira On X, Permitta have announced the departure of Adrian "SpavaQu" Stojek, who had been with the team since June. He averaged a 1.00 rating during his time on the roster. The news comes just days after Permitta failed to qualify for the Europe RMRs after finishing Closed Qualifier B with a 2-3 record. Permitta are now: Tomasz "tomiko" Uroda Martin "maaryy" Nakonieczny Bartosz "bnox" Niebisz Bartek "mASKED" Trybuła Patryk "Sidney" Korab (coach) 9z appeared to be in control of the game against Falcons, but a blunder from Maximiliano "max" Gonzalez on Dust2 marked the beginning of the European side's comeback. After winning a 1v1 situation, the Uruguayan took too long to pick up an AWP and was left with no time to defuse the bomb. Falcons went on a 24-3 run after that round to win the series. Two IEM Rio spots will be decided over the next three days in the European closed qualifier, which boasts teams ranging from Falcons and HEROIC to Cloud9 and OG. Below are the first round matchups of the double elimination bracket, which will kick off later today: On X, FURIA coach Sid "sidde" Macedo didn't mince his words and aired his frustration after yesterday's 2-0 loss to 9 Pandas in the Play-In stage of BetBoom Dacha Belgrade. "Shameful and disastrous CS," he wrote. "We are not doing what we are doing in practice." FURIA are now in a do-or-die situation in Group B, and will fight for survival against Aurora in a few hours. "We will just what needs to be adjusted for tomorrow today and we will turn it around in this tournament, you can trust us." sidde added. "It wasn't our team that got on the server today yesterday."

header: BetBoom Dacha Belgrade S2 playoff bracket set
text: Spirit will look to shrug off their disastrous Cologne showing as they take on Falcons in their opening match. The bracket and opening matchups for the main stage of BetBoom Dacha Belgrade Season 2 have been revealed following the conclusion of the Play-in. FURIA, paiN, Falcons, and Eternal Fire advanced from the first stage to secure spots in the best-of-three, double-elimination bracket, with the two Brazilian teams securing the higher seeds from the Play-in after winning best-of-ones in their respective group finals. As a result, Falcons and Eternal Fire have been matched up against the champions of BetBoom Dacha and BetBoom Dacha Belgrade S1, Spirit and MOUZ, respectively, in the first round of games and on opposite sides of the bracket. Leonid "chopper" Vishnyakov's side arrives in Belgrade looking to shrug off a disastrous showing at IEM Cologne, where Spirit won a combined eight rounds in three out of four map losses. The Russian in-game leader told HLTV that he had the wrong expectations of the team at the event and touched on some issues that cropped up before Cologne, which he says the team has tried to solve ahead of Dacha. "The most important thing for us at this event is to join the server and enjoy playing with each other," he said. Spirit were beaten by MOUZ in Belgrade the last time out, and Kamil "siuhy" Szkaradek's men have remained in excellent form since then while starting to take strides toward shaking off struggles in big arenas by beating G2 in the quarter-finals of IEM Cologne and taking the fight to Natus Vincere in a close 0-2 defeat. The two teams are heavy favorites in the double-elimination bracket, with the other opening-round games featuring teams looking to turn around lackluster starts to the season. Virtus.pro's identity struggles since adding Denis "electroNic" Sharipov continue to plague them, and their issues on the server were laid bare in a 0-2 loss to Falcons in BLAST Fall Showdown. The team comes into Belgrade hoping to bounce back against FURIA, but with Spirit or a rematch against Falcons next in the cards, a solution to their spiral will be needed post-haste. HEROIC, too, are in troubled waters. Although visa issues for Abdul "degster" Gasanov have hamstrung the Norwegian organization in some of its tournament appearances, the team's communication and team play has been a glaring issue, with Eetu "sAw" Saha admitting after HEROIC were eliminated from the Showdown that there are a lot of problems they need to fix. The main stage of BetBoom Dacha Belgrade Season 2 will kick off on Wednesday and run through until Sunday, September 1 when the champion of the double-elimination bracket is crowned. The complete schedule for the tournament can be found on our event page.

header: ESL reveals Pro League S20 opening matchups
text: HEROIC and NIP will meet on the tournament's opening day. ESL has revealed the opening matchups for Pro League Season 20, kicking off on September 3 in Malta with Groups A and B, while Groups C and D will commence on September 10. The 32-team event will run for almost 20 days and feature four groups of eight teams that will play in a triple-elimination bracket, with sixteen teams advancing to a single-elimination playoff round to determine the winner. Group A is headlined by an opening match between HEROIC and Ninjas in Pyjamas, with the winner of that game set to face off against Natus Vincere or Lynn Vision. The group's second-highest-ranked team, FaZe, will meet Sangal, while Eternal Fire have been matched up against FlyQuest. HEROIC vs.  Ninjas in Pyjamas Natus Vincere vs.  Lynn Vision FaZe vs.  Sangal Eternal Fire vs.  FlyQuest The Group B opening round will see a South American derby between 9z and MIBR, who are put on the same side of the bracket as Spirit and Wildcard. KOI will face off against G2, while The MongolZ will battle 3DMAX in a rematch of the Skyesports Championship 2024 grand final. Spirit vs.  Wildcard MIBR vs.  9z The MongolZ vs.  3DMAX KOI vs.  G2 Three-time EPL champions MOUZ will clash with Rooster in the opening matchup in Group C, with the winner set to play against BIG or Imperial. Group C will also see a North American derby between Complexity and M80 and a high-octane fnatic vs. Astralis opening matchup. The match will be the first time Benjamin "blameF" Bremer will face off against his former team, and the first clash between the two organizations since November 2022. MOUZ vs.  Rooster BIG vs.  Imperial Complexity vs.  M80 fnatic vs.  Astralis Group D features Vitality and Liquid, who will face ATOX and ENCE, respectively, in their first matches. Virtus.pro and RED Canids are also set to meet, with FURIA and Falcons closing out the opening round. Vitality vs.  ATOX FURIA vs.  Falcons Liquid vs.  ENCE RED Canids vs.  Virtus.pro

header: FalleN: "9 Pandas said playing us and winning doesn't matter. I wanted to make sure it does"
text: FalleN wanted to exact revenge against 9 Pandas, and he made sure to do exactly that. FURIA have been making steady forward progress since adding Felipe "skullz" Medeiros to their ranks in the player break, making the playoffs of Esports World Cup and the main event at IEM Cologne. They have continued that trend in Belgrade, recovering from an opening loss to 9 Pandas to secure first place in their group and progress from the Play-in. In the process they grabbed a revenge victory over 9 Pandas and a morale-boosting BO1 win over Eternal Fire. The 9 Pandas match came with some added spice, as Aleksandr "shalfey" Marenov had stated to HLTV that his team's result over FURIA was "not a big win," before Gabriel "FalleN" Toledo then said in an interview with esports.gg that 9 Pandas were "not that good." Fresh from his team's two victories, FalleN saw down with HLTV to discuss FURIA's campaign in Belgrade so far, his revenge arc against 9 Pandas, and how far along FURIA are in their development with skullz among their number. If you cannot see the SoundCloud embed above, you can listen to the interview here. First off, congratulations, how does it feel to make the main event? It feels amazing. I think we progressed well after the first match, kept playing well, getting better and getting form. I'm glad that we won first place, it's a good result for us. How does it feel to get a win over Eternal Fire? It must be a confidence-booster, they were top-eight at the last Major. Yeah I like Eternal Fire a lot, we respect each very much and we do pracs against each other once in a while. It's a team that we like to play against, I think they play very well, very structured, and I like watching their games as well. It's always a pleasure to play them and I'm happy with the win, it's a big win for us. You had a couple of struggles on Dust2, twice today you got to 12 rounds and couldn't close it out. What was going on there? Ah sometimes it just doesn't go your way. I think we had a couple of chances to finish here and there, maybe I could have called a bit better to finish it up earlier. There's a few small things that could have gone differently, but overall I think the opponents were putting up a defense as well, they were able to contest us. In the end, it's not about who throws the first punch, it's about who can take more of them. You had a really good day today, particularly against 9 Pandas you were on fire, rolling back the years. Why do you think that was? I really wanted to win this game. I heard that they said playing against us and winning wasn't a big deal, like it doesn't matter. So I just wanted to make sure it does matter, because otherwise you go home. You were very aggressive I think particularly in that game, lots of opening picks on Dust2. Was it along the same lines, wanting to take control of the game? I felt like on the first Dust2 I played during the tournament I used the Long spawns too much on CT side, so it was pretty much a one-sided game for me. For some reason I always got the Long spawn. In this game I came with a different approach, and yeah I was winning the fights, we had some set plays in order for me to capitalize and get some openings, and the rest is just happening. I'm very happy with finding those kills and finding this impact for the team. You brought skullz in and it's a little bit of a different-look FURIA now. Where do you think you are in your journey, how far along are you from getting to top-form, prime FURIA? Honestly, I think we are not where we want to be at, but I think we are on the way, we have been progressing and having good results with skullz so far. So for us its all about getting more understanding of the game, getting more cohension, mainly on maps like Dust2 for example, where KSCERATO and yuurih didn't have many reps with the last iteration. For us it's all about improving every game, improving every tournament. For me personally, it's all about finding a way to play more games like I played today, and being able to mix the roles I have inside the team. I also have to IGL, I have to AWP, so I'm trying to find the balance where I can put more impact on the numbers frag-wise as well, without stopping the other stuff I do for the team as well. It's all about trying to find the combination.

header: BESTIA, Case secure Americas RMR spots
text: Just two more RMR spots remain up for grabs in South America. The second day of the Perfect World Shanghai Major 2024 SA RMR closed qualifier began with BESTIA and Case securing spots at the Americas RMR following their respective wins against KRÜ and W7M. This means just two more spots remain up for grabs. BESTIA and Case will be joined by two teams from the 3-1 pool, with a fourth-place decider set to be played between the two 3-1 teams with the lower Bucholz scores for the final spot. BESTIA began their qualifying campaign with best-of-one victories over Vikings KR and Galorys to make the 2-0 match. There, they would face KRÜ, an organization founded and co-owned by ex-Manchester City striker Sergio Agüero. BESTIA found themselves down a map after a 5-13 loss on Dust2, but bounced back on Ancient (13-4) — where Luciano "luchov" Herrera put up a 2.46 rating — and Anubis (13-8) to make it to the Americas RMR in Shanghai. The second 2-0 match saw W7M meet Case, with the latter another organization owned by a famous footballer — Brazil's Casemiro. His team previously upset RED Canids and breezed past Solid, and their qualification was equally straightforward. A 13-1 win on Anubis was followed by a 13-9 triumph on Inferno, which proved more than enough for Case to book a trip to China.

header: Eternal Fire qualify for IEM Rio
text: The Turkish team locked in the first of two spots at Rio available through the Europe qualifier. Eternal Fire have secured a spot at IEM Rio after romping through the Europe closed qualifier, securing relatively comfortable 2-0 victories over B8, Cloud9, and Falcons to cruise through the upper bracket undefeated. Marco "Snappi" Pfeiffer's side have one more chance to book a ticket to Brazil in the consolidation final, where they await the winner of a lower bracket match between HEROIC and fnatic. Eternal Fire and Falcons took part in the qualifier while playing in Serbia at BetBoom Dacha Belgrade, and both succeeded in advancing from the Play-in stage of the LAN event while simultaneously fighting through the Rio qualifier's upper bracket. Eternal Fire were convincing in their qualifier run as they dismantled B8 and Cloud9 in one-sided series victories, whereas Falcons were tested by OG and 3DMAX in games that went the distance with a handful of close maps. The Turkish team didn't start their qualifying series with the same aplomb, going down 3-9 on their pick of Vertigo against a stalwart defense from Pavle "Maden" Bošković, Álvaro "SunPayus" García, and Snappi, but recovered spectacularly on the CT side. Ismailcan "XANTARES" Dörtkardeş, who ended the first half 1-12 and spoke of how tiring the recent days have been after the game, led the charge in the Turkish team's recovery effort as they pulled the map all the way back and edged out victory, 13-11. Clip: MAJ3R's 1v2 to close the series Falcons fell completely flat on their Anubis pick, a pistol round win on the CT side being all they had to their name for most of the first half before they added two to their tally before the side switch. Eternal Fire won the second pistol and quickly reached series point, 12-3, and although Falcons started to close the gap after an untimely disconnect for one of the Turks, Engin "MAJ3R" Küpeli put a halt to the effort with a 1vs2 clutch to close the game. The team list for IEM Rio is now:

header: Wildcard, Nouns advance to Americas RMR
text: BOSS and NRG drop to the 2-1 pool with just one remaining chance to qualify. Wildcard and Nouns have locked in spots at the Perfect World Shanghai Major Americas RMR after going 3-0 through the NA closed qualifier's Swiss stage. The teams claimed victory over BOSS and NRG, respectively, in the first advancement matches, leaving just two spots up for grabs to teams who go through with a 3-1 record. A fourth-place decider will be played between the two 3-1 teams with the lowest Bucholz score for the final spot. The result leaves NRG in a particualrly precarious position with a match against Legacy likely in the cards, as long as the Brazilian team is not eliminated by Take Flyte. Gabriel "NEKIZ" Schenato's side was upset by BOSS in the second round of play and ended up in the elimination pool early, with BOSS going on to face Wildcard for a spot at the RMR. Matthew "Cryptic" Whitmore's side couldn't make it through on their first try, however, with Wildcard looking fearsome since adding Swedish duo Love "phzy" Smidebrant and Tim "susp" Ångström. The team eased past Mythic and E-Xolos LAZER in the best-of-one rounds before beating BOSS 2-0 in the advancement match, needing all 24 rounds on Nuke before running away with Dust2 after a slow start. Nouns didn't have an easy run to their RMR spot, going from beating FLUFFY AIMERS 13-6 to nearly losing to a comeback to Party Astronauts, eventually closing the game 16-13. They got off to a strong start on NRG's pick of Anubis, going up 7-3 on the T side, but lost the edge near the end of the first half and were run over once on the defense, 10-13. Nouns wasted little time in recovering from that, however, crushing NRG 13-6 on Ancient before a 1.80-rated performance from Jeorge "Jeorge"  Endicott on the Mirage decider helped his team take things over the line.

header: Final matches set for Americas RMR qualifiers
text: Just four spots remain between the North and South American qualifiers for the Americas RMR. Day two of the North and South American closed qualifiers for the Perfect World Shanghai Major Americas RMR has drawn to a close, seeing four sides reach the RMR while eight more sides endured elimination. Wildcard and Nouns were the victors in the North American qualifier, booking their tickets to Shanghai after claiming 3-0 records in the Swiss bracket. In regards to eliminations, by far the most notable side to miss out on a shot of reaching the RMR was Party Astronauts, who were stamped out by a FLUFFY AIMERS lineup recently invigorated by the addition of Edgar "MarKE" Maldonado. The other three sides to bow out on day two in North America's qualifier were Mythic, Akimbo, and Take Flyte, the latter of whom received a post-elimination disqualification for improper use of a substitute during their elimination match against Legacy. Meanwhile, in the South American qualifier, Case and BESTIA emerged victorious with 3-0 records to claim the first two RMR spots from that qualifier. The four squads who suffered the unenviable fate of elimination in South America's qualifier were inSanitY, Galorys, Sharks, and Solid. With that, the 2-1 matches in North America are: In South America, the 2-1 matches are: As only two spots in the RMR remain in each qualifier, the highest-seed winner of the 2-1 matches will advance directly to the Americas RMR, while the two lower-seed winners will compete in a fourth-place decider match for the final spot from their respective qualifier.

header: Live updates from BetBoom Dacha Belgrade Season 2 day one
text: Falcons 3-3  Spirit Marco "Snappi" Pfeiffer has had the perfect positioning in three rounds in a row now. The Secret sneak got him a kill on Danil "donk" Kryshkovets in round 4, then hiding Red crate got him another on donk the round after, before Spirit ran into a double Ramp setup in round 6. All tied up. Spirit 3-1  Falcons The now customary seonc round 5-MP9 buy came out of Falcons, and some damage and saving meant they kept a similar amount of firepower to Spirit in all four rounds so far. Marco "Snappi" Pfeiffer's Secret sneak from Ramp for a pick on Danil "donk" Kryshkovets is what grants them the first win. "For now they are the better team, but it goes back and forth." Can a (somehow) in-form Falcons take advantage of Spirit's slump? paiN, Falcons, FURIA, and Eternal Fire were the teams to make it to the main event, four of the top five highest-ranked teams (with 9z missing out). The best bit was the trash talk between Gabriel "FalleN" Toledo and 9 Pandas — with the Brazilian veteran delivering a 1.65 rating in a rematch that eliminated Aleksandr "shalfey" Marenov and company. Group stage? What group stage? We're straight into the BO3 double elimination bracket with eight teams all in the top 20.

header: All teams added to BB Dacha playoffs fantasy
text: The $500,000 LAN event is included in the Fantasy season. - You can create your teams on the Fantasy page here. - Eight-team, double-elimination best-of-three bracket with a best-of-five grand final. - As usual, picking a team to go the distance is important in this format since it features a high number of rounds. - Teams who win the upper semi-finals and upper final will receive padding for the following round. - Since the base level prices were calculated when only five out of eight teams were confirmed, the prices are slightly different than usual. - Fantasy players can count on both season points and skin prizes as follows: 1. Hydra Gloves | Mangrove (Field-Tested)2. M4A1-S | Hyper Beast (Field-Tested)3. AK-47 | Neon Revolution (Field-Tested)
